title: 11. Augustus and the People of Rome
description: Augustus’ management of the Senate, equites, and plebs to secure stability while preserving Republican forms.

questions.question: Why did Augustus try to preserve Republican forms of government?
options: He believed the Republic was still functioning effectively
To avoid causing offence and gain cooperation

questions.question: Why was Augustus dependent on the cooperation of the Senate?
options: The administration of the empire was too large for one man

questions.question: How did Augustus revise the senatorial rolls?
What number did Augustus eventually settle on for Senate membership?
What qualification was required to be a senator under Augustus?
How did Augustus encourage the sons of senators to engage in public life?
options: By allowing them to wear the toga laticlave

questions.question: How did Augustus try to restore dignity to the Senate?
options: By introducing ceremonial behaviour and penalties

questions.question: What punishment was introduced for senators who failed to attend sessions?
How often did the Senate meet under Augustus’ reforms?
What was the role of the Senate committee created by Augustus?
options: To prepare business for Senate sessions

questions.question: How was the consulship altered after 5 BCE?
options: It was reduced to a six-month term

questions.question: What additional responsibilities were given to praetors after 22 BCE?
How did Augustus expand opportunities within the cursus honorum?
Why did Augustus create new roles for equites?
options: To reduce conflict with the Senate

questions.question: What qualifications were required for membership of the equestrian order?
What privileges were granted to equites?
options: Distinctive dress, jury service, and seating rights

questions.question: How did Augustus bind the plebs to himself politically?
How did Augustus change eligibility for the grain dole?
What was Augustus’ concern regarding handouts to the plebs?
How did Augustus maintain the loyalty of the plebs?
According to Tacitus, how did Augustus secure overall stability?
options: By seducing each group with targeted benefits
